# a11y-standards

The place for all the A11y standards, best practices, naming conventions and other amenities

A screen reader is a technology that helps people who have difficulty seeing access and interact with digital content, like websites or applications via audio or touch or keyboard. The main users of screen readers are people who are blind or have very limited vision.

This is one of the most important websites for accessibility:
https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/patterns/
it has definitions of keyboard interactions, aria attributes and rules for properly implementing visual patterns for accessibility.

Here are some other useful accessibility links:
https://medium.com/weekly-webtips/10-accessibility-best-practices-cb66b666fa0f
https://dev.to/brittneypostma/accessibility-best-practices-for-html-css-d51?s=09
